conversations.body_text: Hello, the minimum purchase amount required to use this discount is $199.

The initial email specifically notates what is in my cart and says nothing about a minimum purchase. That’s deceptive advertising. Let me know if that’s how you’re going to operate and I’ll find other reputable brands to purchase from.

Dan Wells

Sent from [Proton Mail](https://proton.me/mail/home) for iOS.

-------- Original Message --------

I guess because you guys feel good about false advertising and can’t be bothered to do the right thing or even respond to my email, I’ll take my business to another brand that operates more respectably.

It’s a shame because I like the pedals that I already purchased so far and just wanted to try to get another set for a family member. I had a couple friends and others in my league that were also interested, but I’ll be letting them all know how you treat your customers.

I would like my account deactivated and I would also like to be contacted by someone in leadership.

Dan Wells

Sent from [Proton Mail](https://proton.me/mail/home) for iOS.

-------- Original Message --------

Hi Dan Wells,    Sorry for the delayed response—we just wrapped up our 8-day holiday. We currently have a $35 promotional discount available, with a minimum purchase requirement of $199, which might be helpful for you.

Please deactivate my account. Your company is dishonest and deceptive. You won’t see anymore business from me.

Dan Wells

Sent from [Proton Mail](https://proton.me/mail/home) for iOS.

-------- Original Message --------

Also, when will management be reaching out to discuss the original email that offered a discount and referenced exactly what I had in my cart, and in no way mentioned any kind of minimum purchase in my cart?

Who will be reaching out to discuss your false advertising practices and the poor customer service that followed?

Dan Wells

Sent from [Proton Mail](https://proton.me/mail/home) for iOS.

-------- Original Message --------

Hi Dan Wells,    We've created a $10 discount for you: DN10  Valid on orders over $99.  Our discounts typically have minimum purchase requirements—this is standard practice. Most require a $199 minimum, though some may occasionally omit usage conditions. If a discount cannot be applied, the reason will be clearly indicated during checkout. Thank you for your understanding.

So besides falsely advertising to me via email, you are now giving me a lower discount and admitting that you omitted the usage conditions. Still waiting to hear from your boss.

Dan Wells

Sent from [Proton Mail](https://proton.me/mail/home) for iOS.

-------- Original Message --------

As soon as the government reopens, I’ll be filing a complaint with Federal Trade Commission. We have protections against scams like these. Please catch yourself up on Truth-In-Advertising laws from their website.

You don’t get to say “come here for this deal” and then move the goal posts. Omitting usage conditions is not a standard practice, it’s standard fraudulence.

Don’t considered this case closed or resolved. Get this email to your owner and legal team.

Dan Wells
